fluid.tconstruct.blazing_blood.fluid_eff: Blazing blood is an acceptable fluid for combat, but it really shines as a light source.
fluid.tconstruct.powdered_snow.fluid_eff: Powdered snow is a useful fluid for nether combat, dealing bonus damage to blazing mobs.
fluid.tconstruct.honey.fluid_effect: So sweet, and removes toxins, what not to love with slurping honey?
fluid.tconstruct.beetroot_soup.fluid_eff: Beetroot soup is an easily farmable slurpable food option.
fluid.tconstruct.mushroom_stew.fluid_eff: Mushroom stew is a very affordable soup option for slurping on the go.
fluid.tconstruct.rabbit_stew.fluid_effec: Rabbit stew is the best liquid food available, ideal for slurping.
fluid.tconstruct.meat_soup.fluid_effect: Don't ask what is in the meat soup; just enjoy the flavor as you slurp this down.
fluid.tconstruct.potion.fluid_effect: Potions allow a wide variety of effects crafted in a brewing stand. Can dump potions into tanks to fill tools.
fluid.tconstruct.earth_slime.fluid_effec: Earthslime is a portable piston, ideal for simple flying carpets. Well, assuming bricks count as carpet.
fluid.tconstruct.sky_slime.fluid_effect: Skyslime is a portable piston, ideal for when you built your base just 1 block away from where it belongs.
fluid.tconstruct.venom.fluid_effect: Venom pairs very well with venombone, the hint is in the name.
fluid.tconstruct.ichor.fluid_effect: Ichor is a reverse gravity fluid, helping you also reverse gravity. Surviving the trip back down is on you.
fluid.tconstruct.seared_stone.fluid_effe: Most unusual method of smeltery construction.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_clay.fluid_effec: Great for quickly building a wall, or just solidifying clay without a cast.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_glass.fluid_effe: Molten glass can quickly solidify into an easily removable window.
fluid.tconstruct.liquid_soul.fluid_effec: Liquid soul lets you greatly slow opponents, at least that is the hope.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_obsidian.fluid_e: Molten obsidian becomes a very difficult to remove blockage.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_emerald.fluid_ef: Molten emerald is the choice for mining when you need silk touch.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_quartz.fluid_eff: Molten quartz is a modest mining fluid, not too expensive and not too strong.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_amethyst.fluid_e: Molten amethyst is the cheapest mining fluid, but its not very strong.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_diamond.fluid_ef: Molten diamond lets you maximize the drops of your ores, but is it worth the cost of the fluid?
fluid.tconstruct.molten_ender.fluid_effe: Placing blocks turns a slimestaff into a building wand.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_iron.fluid_effec: Molten iron is used to draw nearby items towards you, though in a pinch it can be useful in combat.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_gold.fluid_effec: Molten gold first hurts you, then it heals you back more. Is it worth it? Up to you.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_copper.fluid_eff: Molten copper is a good emergency air supply for long underwater journeys.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_cobalt.fluid_eff: Inhaling the lingering cloud is the safest way to use molten cobalt for haste, or just use it as a weapon.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_debris.fluid_eff: Molten debris is the strongest fluid for mining, even capable of mining obsidian.
Sometimes you really want to fight some phantoms, drinking a lot of molten amethyst bronze can help that happen.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_rose_gold.fluid_: Molten rose gold lets you lose a small amount of health for a temporary edge.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_pig_iron.fluid_e: Molten pig iron is the tastiest of molten metals. Not that its much of a competition.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_manyullyn.fluid_: Molten manyullyn has the most damage potential between flat damage and damage over time.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_hepatizon.fluid_: Is molten hepatizon best for defense, or combat? Either is a risk reward setup.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_knightmetal.flui: Ironically, Knightmetal is most suited to killing those from who it comes.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_netherite.fluid_: Molten netherite is the highest base damage, for when you cannot wait for your target to bleed out.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_tin.fluid_effect: They say carrots are good for your eyes, but molten tin is better.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_aluminum.fluid_e: Molten aluminium is like milk, but aggressive. Ideal for combat when your opponents have too many effects.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_lead.fluid_effec: Molten lead gives your attacks a little extra boost, if you are willing to wait.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_silver.fluid_eff: Molten silver removes toxins without removing helpful effects.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_nickel.fluid_eff: Molten nickel lets you harm your enemies and reduce the risk of retaliation, what's not to love?
fluid.tconstruct.molten_zinc.fluid_effec: Molten zinc is probably not the best choice to boost your speed, perhaps the speed will throw off an opponent.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_platinum.fluid_e: Not sure the applications of molten platinum slowing your enemies' mining speed, but you can probably figure one out.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_tungsten.fluid_e: Molten tungsten is one of the heaviest metals, hopefully it will keep your enemies still.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_osmium.fluid_eff: Molten osmium keeps your enemies still for a future blow.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_uranium.fluid_ef: Radioactive decay from molten uranium isn't safe to be around, so dump it on your enemies.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_chromium.fluid_e: If only luck was actually a useful effect, this fluid would be great to drink!
fluid.tconstruct.molten_bronze.fluid_eff: Molten bronze is the perfect dark brown beverage for when you need to stay away and stave off phantoms.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_brass.fluid_effe: Molten brass helps you resist the heat, and the second sip is free if you time it right.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_electrum.fluid_e: Molten electrum is great for when you need to mine fast on a budget.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_invar.fluid_effe: Molten invar may be useful if you are trying to eat that powerful cake, but otherwise is an odd fluid.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_constantan.fluid: Molten constantan is useful against human opponents perhaps, but not so much against monsters.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_pewter.fluid_eff: Molten pewter is probably lower risk than venom to boost your strength, but not by much.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_steel.fluid_effe: Molten steel lets you clear out enemies around you, or spread out bunched up enemies.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_enderium.fluid_e: Molten enderium is ideal as a weapon, keeping enemies from teleporting as you fight.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_lumium.fluid_eff: Molten lumium is either used to keep your eye on the target or make a quick but obvious escape.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_refined_glowston: Molten refined glowstone is great for tracking targets without sacrificing much damage.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_refined_obsidian: Molten refined obsidian maximizes damage against armored targets.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_nicrosil.fluid_e: Nicrosil has an innate pull on magic, seems like a waste to use it like this.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_bendalloy.fluid_: A perfect snack for the middle of a battle.
fluid.tconstruct.molten_steeleaf.fluid_e: Useful both for you and your target to maximize gained experience.
fluid.tconstruct.fiery_liquid.fluid_effe: You might think this is a fantastic deal, so many extra ingots! But remember, fiery is really hard to get.
item.tconstruct.quartz_shuriken.tooltip: A throwable weapon with higher damage
item.tconstruct.flint_shuriken.tooltip: A throwable weapon with high knockback
item.tconstruct.piggy_backpack.tooltip: Use on a mob to pick it up
block.tconstruct.part_chest.tooltip: Holds up to 256 different tool parts
block.tconstruct.tinkers_chest.tooltip: Holds up to 64 stacks of 16 items
_comment_on_format_: These format allows you to have more control over separators in material names. By default we separate with space. You can use %1$s and %2$s if you wish to change the order.
item.tconstruct.dummy_tool_part.tooltip: Used to create casts, cannot be used to create tools.
item.tconstruct.repair_kit.tooltip: Use on a tool in the inventory to repair it the equivalent of %s ingots
item.tconstruct.pickaxe.description:
The Pickaxe is a precise mining tool. It is effective on stone and ores.
It breaks blocks, OK?
item.tconstruct.sledge_hammer.descriptio:
The Sledge Hammer is a broad mining tool. It harvests blocks in a wide range.
Also effective against undead.
item.tconstruct.vein_hammer.description: The Vein Hammer is a broad mining tool. It harvests many connected blocks of the same type, perfect for ores.
item.tconstruct.mattock.description:
The Cutter Mattock is a versatile farming tool. It is effective on logs, dirt, sand, gravel, and plants.
Just don't dig your own grave!
item.tconstruct.pickadze.description: The Pickadze is a versatile mining tool. It is effective on rock, dirt, sand and gravel, but is not sharp enough to mine tougher stone blocks like many ores.
item.tconstruct.excavator.description:
The Excavator is a broad digging tool. It digs up large areas of soil and snow in a wide range.
Terraforming!
item.tconstruct.hand_axe.description:
The Hand Axe chops up wood and makes short work of leaves. It also makes for an effective weapon.
Chop chop!
item.tconstruct.broad_axe.description:
The Broad Axe fells small trees in a single swing, and makes quick work of large trees. It makes for a powerful heavy weapon.
Timber!
item.tconstruct.kama.description:
The Kama is a precision reaping tool, mowing down plants and shearing animals.
Right Click: Harvest and replant crops
item.tconstruct.scythe.description:
The Scythe is a broad reaping tool, mowing down plants in a wide area.
Right Click: Harvest and replant crops
item.tconstruct.dagger.description: The Dagger is a light weapon, capable of quick strikes from either hand.
item.tconstruct.sword.description:
The Sword is a universal weapon. Sweep attacks keep enemy hordes at bay.
Also good against cobwebs!
item.tconstruct.cleaver.description: The Cleaver is a weapon for a smeltery master. High range attacks keep cut through the toughest of foes.
item.tconstruct.crossbow.description: The Crossbow is a light ranged weapon, capable of quickly firing arrows and fireworks.
item.tconstruct.longbow.description: The Longbow is a broad ranged weapon, capable of firing arrows with precision over long distances.
item.tconstruct.fishing_rod.description: The Fishing Rod is a light ranged weapon, capable of short distance attacks without requiring ammo. It also can be used to fish if you're into that.
item.tconstruct.javelin.description: The Javelin is a hybrid melee/ranged weapon, ideal for both melee combat along with throwing for ranged damage. Just be careful after throwing as you will be without a weapon.
item.tconstruct.arrow.description: Arrows are your standard single-use projectile weapon, fired from both longbows and crossbows.
gui.tconstruct.plate_armor.description: Plate armor is a highly defensive armor set with limited ability slots.
gui.tconstruct.thrown_ammo.description: Shurikens and throwing axes are simple, disposable projectiles that can be thrown directly without any other tools. Shurikens fly a bit further, while axes deal more damage.
block.tconstruct.copper_gauge.tooltip: Interacting with the gauge shows the amount of fluid in the tank behind the gauge
block.tconstruct.obsidian_gauge.tooltip: Shows the type of fluid in the tank behind the gauge, and shows the amount when interacting.

material.tconstruct.wood.flavor: How much wood could a woodchuck chuck if a woodchuck could chuck wood?
material.tconstruct.wood.encyclopedia: Makes repairs 50% more effective per part.
material.tconstruct.wood.ammo: Grants you twice as many arrows when crafting or part swapping, though lose half of the arrows when swapping from wood.
material.tconstruct.bamboo.ranged: Movement penalty when drawing back the bow is reduced by 10%
material.tconstruct.bamboo.armor: Movement penalty when using the shield is reduced by 10%
material.tconstruct.bamboo.ammo: Gives the projectile +0.5 accuracy, making arrows have perfect accuracy (even in inaccurate bows). Thrown weapons also get +25% velocity.
material.tconstruct.ice.armor: Converts taken cold damage into durability shield.
material.tconstruct.ice.ammo: Freezes the target for 4 seconds (plus 4 seconds per level), causing slowness and damage over time.
material.tconstruct.cactus.flavor: A spiky shield spikes serious stabbers.
material.tconstruct.cactus.ranged: Adds +0.1 velocity per level at the cost of losing 1 health per level when firing arrows.
material.tconstruct.cactus.ammo: Adds +0.1 velocity per level and +0.5 power to thrown ammo at the cost of losing 1 health per level when launched.
material.tconstruct.cactus.armor: Adds a 15% chance to deal 1-4 damage on counterattacks, or a 30% chance when blocking.
material.tconstruct.rock.encyclopedia: Causes the tool to mine faster by 1% times the square root of lost durability each level. Tool durability multiplier will divide the lost durability.
material.tconstruct.flint.flavor: This will spark the flames of a Tinker's heart!
material.tconstruct.flint.encyclopedia: Increases melee damage by 1% times the square root of lost durability each level. Tool durability multiplier will divide the lost durability.
material.tconstruct.flint.ammo: Allows casting potion on the ammo to tip it. Tipped ammo will apply a potion effect in addition to its damage.
material.tconstruct.bone.flavor: I am the bone of my sword
material.tconstruct.bone.encyclopedia: Increases melee damage by 0.5 and grants 2 armor pierce per level for 5 seconds
material.tconstruct.bone.ranged: Arrows apply 2 armor pierce per level for 5 seconds
material.tconstruct.bone.armor: Has a 15% chance when hit for attackers receive 2 armor pierce per level for 5 seconds (or 10 seconds if blocking).
material.tconstruct.bone.ammo: Causes the arrow to pierce through the first target it hits, while thrown projectiles disable shields.
material.tconstruct.bone.skull_encyclope: Grants resistance for 1 minute after drinking milk
material.tconstruct.necrotic_bone.flavor: Do you have a bone to pick with me?
material.tconstruct.necrotic_bone.encycl: Heals 5% per level of damage dealt from critical hits
material.tconstruct.necrotic_bone.ranged: Heals 5% per level of damage dealt from successful arrow hits
material.tconstruct.necrotic_bone.armor: Has a 15% chance when hit to heal over time 25% of damage received.
material.tconstruct.necrotic_bone.ammo: Heals 5% per level of damage dealt from successful hits
material.tconstruct.necrotic_bone.skull_: Melee attacks cause withering. After drinking milk the effect becomes faster
material.tconstruct.chorus.flavor: Not just the endermen, but the enderwomen, and the enderchildren
material.tconstruct.chorus.encyclopedia: Prevents the target from teleporting for a 5 seconds per effect level
material.tconstruct.chorus.ranged: Prevents the target from teleporting for a 5 seconds per effect level and allows damaging endermen with arrows
material.tconstruct.chorus.armor: Has a 25% chance randomly teleporting attackers away, or a 50% chance when blocking.
material.tconstruct.chorus.ammo: Prevents the target from teleporting for 5 seconds per level, and can be fired at endermen.
material.tconstruct.string.encyclopedia: Allows the tool to be repaired using string in the tinker station or crafting table
material.tconstruct.string.skull_flavor: Spiders are a master of potions, maybe their secret can help me enhance potions...
material.tconstruct.string.skull_encyclo: Causes positive potion effects to last 25% longer
material.tconstruct.leather.flavor: Killed a cow, tanned it's hide.
material.tconstruct.leather.encyclopedia: Prevents the tool from taking more than 1 damage in an action
material.tconstruct.leather.skull_encycl: Melee attacks increase the targets fire time based on the wearer's fire time
material.tconstruct.vine.flavor: Keeps living, unlike the social network.
material.tconstruct.vine.encyclopedia: Tool has up to a 75% chance to resist damage in full sunlight
material.tconstruct.iron.flavor: Ironic. He could save others from death, but not himself.
material.tconstruct.iron.encyclopedia: Causes mining blocks and hitting mobs to attract nearby items.
material.tconstruct.iron.ranged: Causes firing arrows to attract nearby items to the holder.
material.tconstruct.iron.armor: Reduces damage from projectiles by 8% per level, and grants 5% knockback resistance times the max level.
material.tconstruct.iron.skull_encyclope: Melee attacks copy all negative status effects from the wearer to the target
material.tconstruct.seared_stone.encyclo: Gives +6 mining speed against blocks that can be melted in a melter
material.tconstruct.seared_stone.armor: Reduces damage from fire by 10% per level, and reduces fire burn time
material.tconstruct.scorched_stone.encyc: Gives +2 damage per level against burning targets
material.tconstruct.scorched_stone.armor: Reduces damage from fire immune mobs by 5% per level, and reduces fire burn time
material.tconstruct.copper.flavor: Don't let this tarnish your day.
material.tconstruct.copper.encyclopedia: Grants bonus mining speed at lower depth, +6 per 64 blocks below 64
material.tconstruct.copper.ranged: Grants bonus velocity at lower depth, +0.05 per 64 blocks below 64
material.tconstruct.copper.armor: Grants bonus protection at lower depth, +5% per 64 blocks below 64
material.tconstruct.copper.skull_flavor: Knocks the wind right out of them
material.tconstruct.copper.skull_encyclo: Melee attacks steal 3 seconds of air from the target
material.tconstruct.gold.armor: Grants 10% protection per level against magic damage and reduces the time of negative potion effects. Also makes piglins friendly.
material.tconstruct.gold.skull_encyclope: Causes some gold ores to drop extra gold nuggets, and increases drop chance of gold armor by 4%. Nuggets and armor drops are further boosted by each piece of golden armor worn.
material.tconstruct.slimewood.flavor: Is this the wood of a slime or slime that's been infused with wood?
material.tconstruct.slimewood.encycloped: Gives a 5% chance per level of regenerating overslime each second
material.tconstruct.slimewood.ammo: Causes projectiles moving fast enough to bounce off blocks they hit up to 3 times
material.tconstruct.slimeskin.encycloped: Gives a 5% chance per level of regenerating overslime each second
material.tconstruct.venombone.flavor: Become the bane of your enemies
material.tconstruct.venombone.encycloped: Boosts melee damage when poisoned by 0.5 plus the level of poison
material.tconstruct.venombone.ranged: Boosts drawspeed when poisoned by 0.05 plus 0.1 per level of poison
material.tconstruct.venombone.armor: Has a 15% chance when hit to make attacker take 200% magic damage for the next 5 to 10 seconds (or up to 15 seconds if blocking).
material.tconstruct.venombone.ammo: Causes the target to take 200% magic damage for the next 5 to 10 seconds.
material.tconstruct.venombone.skull_ency: Projectiles cause slowness to the target. After drinking milk, melee attacks cause slowness and the level is stronger.
material.tconstruct.rose_gold.flavor: Disclaimer: Not actually made with roses.
material.tconstruct.rose_gold.encycloped: Grants 1 extra upgrade slot per part
material.tconstruct.rose_gold.skull_flav: Putting that arm shield to good use
material.tconstruct.rose_gold.skull_ency: Boosts health by 1 heart, plus an additional heart per piece of golden armor.
material.tconstruct.skyslime_vine.flavor: Float like a butterfly, sting like a bee.
material.tconstruct.skyslime_vine.encycl: Cancels out the mining speed reduction when not on the ground
material.tconstruct.skyslime_vine.ranged: Grants +0.1 velocity when not on the ground or a ladder
material.tconstruct.weeping_vine.encyclo: Grants up to +1.25 melee damage in hot biomes, but lose up to -1.25 melee damage in cold biomes.
material.tconstruct.weeping_vine.ranged: Grants +0.75 power in hot biomes, but lose up to -0.75 power in cold biomes
material.tconstruct.weeping_vine.armor: Grants up to +5% protection in hot biomes, but lose up to -5% protection in cold biomes
material.tconstruct.twisting_vine.encycl: Grants +6 mining speed at the cost of losing 1 health when you put down the tool
material.tconstruct.twisting_vine.ranged: Grants +15% draw speed at the cost of losing 1 health when you put down the tool
material.tconstruct.twisting_vine.armor: Grants +10% knockback resistance at the cost of losing 2 health when you remove the armor
material.tconstruct.wool.ammo: Multiplies the projectile damage by 0. Note damage may still be increased by bow power, and it may still aggravate mobs.
material.tconstruct.feather.ammo: Has no special effect, but unlike other fletching choices lacks a downside.
material.tconstruct.leaves.ammo: Grants you half as many arrows when crafting or part swapping, though they might be gained back if swapping from leaves.
material.tconstruct.amethyst.flavor: Protects you from bad aim, provided you were aiming straight ahead
material.tconstruct.amethyst.ammo: Grants +0.75 projectile damage per level, but restricts the angles the projectile may be thrown at. Stacks with amethyst bronze bows to further restrict angles.
material.tconstruct.prismarine.ammo: Lets the ammo move freely underwater and grants +1 projectile damage per level to underwater targets. Fishing rods instead gain a level of lure.
material.tconstruct.gunpowder.ammo: Causes the arrow to explode at a radius of 1 plus 1 per level. Explosion damage is based on projectile power.
material.tconstruct.earthslime.ammo: Causes the target to be knocked back in the opposite direction.
material.tconstruct.skyslime.ammo: Increases the knockback of the projectile.
material.tconstruct.blaze.ammo: Causes arrows to ignite, burning targets for 5 seconds per level.
material.tconstruct.ender_pearl.ammo: Causes you to teleport to the location the projectile lands, destroying it. If it hits a monster, swaps places.
material.tconstruct.ender_pearl.skull_fl: Endermen know how to stay away from harm, and scientists. They have been ignoring my interview requests for weeks!
material.tconstruct.ender_pearl.skull_en: Teleports automatically when attacked by a projectile, and randomly from melee. Has a 15 second cooldown
material.tconstruct.glass.ammo: Decreases projectile damage by 0.75 per level, but gives it a tank. Upon impact, applies fluid effects from the fluid in the tank. Ammo breaks upon hitting a block when filled.
material.tconstruct.glass.skull_flavor: Whose nice things are being destroyed now, creeper?
material.tconstruct.glass.skull_encyclop: Holding the helmet interact key while sneaking causes the wearer to explode
material.tconstruct.slimesteel.flavor: You must steal the slime to get slimesteel.
material.tconstruct.slimesteel.encyclope: Grants 25 extra overslime, +50% of the total per level
material.tconstruct.nahuatl.flavor: This is not an obsidian part, if it was it would say "Obsidian."
material.tconstruct.nahuatl.encyclopedia: Causes 1 damage per second over time for 2 seconds per level. Consecutive hits add instead of replacing the time.
material.tconstruct.nahuatl.armor: Has a 25% chance per level (50% if blocking) of doing up to 5 damage over time
material.tconstruct.obsidian.flavor: This is an obsidian part, if it was not it would not say "Obsidian."
material.tconstruct.obsidian.armor: Grants 10% protection per level against explosions, and reduces explosion knockback
material.tconstruct.amethyst_bronze.flav: Not to be confused with bronze.
material.tconstruct.amethyst_bronze.ency: Grants +1 mining speed per level to blocks that don't require tools, notably ones where the tool is not effective
material.tconstruct.amethyst_bronze.rang: Adds +0.1 velocity per level at the cost of limiting arrow angles to 32, 16, or 8 directions at the first 3 levels respectively
material.tconstruct.amethyst_bronze.armo: Grants +2.5% attack speed per level at the cost of limiting taken knockback angles to 32, 16, 8, or 4 directions
material.tconstruct.pig_iron.flavor: The absolute best material, no debates.
material.tconstruct.pig_iron.encyclopedi: Can be eaten to restore 1 hunger per level at 0.6 saturation
material.tconstruct.pig_iron.armor: Grants a 15% chance per level of eating the armor for 1 hunger per level at 0.6 saturation
material.tconstruct.pig_iron.skull_flavo: You won't like me when I'm angry!
material.tconstruct.pig_iron.skull_encyc: Grants 15 seconds of strength when damaged by another mob
material.tconstruct.darkthread.flavor: Come to the dark side, we have sowing
material.tconstruct.darkthread.encyclope: Increases drop chances from mobs, stacking with luck
material.tconstruct.darkthread.ranged: Increases drop chances from mobs killed by arrows
material.tconstruct.darkthread.skull_fla: Perfect for battles of wits, when you have to decide and drink to find out who is right.
material.tconstruct.darkthread.skull_enc: Makes the wearer immune to poison, though will not remove existing poison
material.tconstruct.cobalt.flavor: Coblat. The material of the Red Army.
material.tconstruct.cobalt.encyclopedia: Boosts mining and attack speed by 8% per level
material.tconstruct.cobalt.ranged: Boosts drawspeed and velocity by +0.03 per level
material.tconstruct.cobalt.armor: Reduces damage from melee attacks by 8% per level, and boosts movement speed when using items by 5% per max level
material.tconstruct.quartz.ammo: Increases projectile damage by 0.5 per level.
material.tconstruct.dragon_scale.flavor: With this, even dragons will fear me!
material.tconstruct.dragon_scale.armor: Grants +10% resistance while airborne, and boosts attack damage by 5% per level based on the highest piece.
material.tconstruct.dragon_scale.ammo: Increases projectile damage by 1 per level if launched while in mid air.
material.tconstruct.shulker.armor: Grants +10% resistance while sneaking, but decreases attack damage by 10% per level while sneaking.
material.tconstruct.shulker.ammo: Allows collecting projectiles that hit entities instead of just blocks, making them infinitely reusable. Item will additionally not despawn.
material.tconstruct.manyullyn.flavor: The metal that most Tinkers will never pronounce right. Also known as a star cutting material.
material.tconstruct.manyullyn.encycloped: Grants up to +2.5 damage per level, with the damage increasing by +0.5 per level per hit over 5 consecutive hits
material.tconstruct.manyullyn.ranged: Arrows gain up to +1.25 power per level, with the damage increasing by +0.25 per level per hit over 5 consecutive arrow hits
material.tconstruct.manyullyn.armor: Temporarily boosts melee damage by 1 after taking damage, capping at the total level across all armor
material.tconstruct.hepatizon.flavor: He-pa-ti-zon - boil it, mash it, put it in a stew.
material.tconstruct.hepatizon.encycloped: Boosts mining speed by up to 25% per level, increasing by +2.5% per level over 10 consecutive blocks mined
material.tconstruct.hepatizon.ranged: Boosts drawspeed by up to 25% per level, increasing by +2.5% per level over 10 consecutive arrows fired
material.tconstruct.hepatizon.armor: Converts 50% of damage taken into a temporary flat damage reduction. Reduction lasts 5 seconds per level.
material.tconstruct.ichorskin.flavor: Ichor definately does not have skin
material.tconstruct.ichorskin.encycloped: Consumes up to 5 overslime to reduce damage by 1% per overslime consumed (up to 5%).
material.tconstruct.cinderslime.encyclop: Uses fuel to restore overslime, restoring 1 per second by level 4.
material.tconstruct.queens_slime.flavor: Princesses are evil, get yourself a Queen.
material.tconstruct.queens_slime.encyclo: Reduces durability by 15% per level, 66% of that going towards overslime
material.tconstruct.blazing_bone.flavor: Harness the full power of the Nether Fortress - bone and blaze
material.tconstruct.blazing_bone.encyclo: Grants +2% damage per second of fire, up to +20% from 10+ seconds. Bonus reduced by fire resistance.
material.tconstruct.blazing_bone.ranged: Grants +2% arrow damage per second of fire, up to +20% from 10+ seconds. Bonus reduced by fire resistance.
material.tconstruct.blazing_bone.armor: Has a 15% chance when hit to cause attackers to take 200% fire damage for the next 5 to 10 seconds (or up to 15 seconds if blocking).
material.tconstruct.blazing_bone.ammo: Causes the target to take 200% fire damage for the next 5 to 10 seconds.
material.tconstruct.blazing_bone.skull_f: I told them this is technically firespit, not firebreath, but apparently I don't get to decide the names for things I invent
material.tconstruct.blazing_bone.skull_e: Allows spitting firecharges from the inventory as fireballs. Has a cooldown of 5 seconds and does not work underwater
material.tconstruct.blazewood.encycloped: Inflicts the attacker with 10 seconds of glowing, or 20 seconds when blocking.
material.tconstruct.blazewood.ammo: Causes the target to glow for 10 seconds. If it hits a block, places a permanent light source at the cost of the projectile.
material.tconstruct.ichor.ammo: Projectile will bounce upon hitting a block up to 1 time, plus 2 per level. Increases power by 0.5 per bounce per level before hitting the target.
material.tconstruct.magma.ammo: Projectile will disappear half a second after launch, causing some traits to run in the air.
material.tconstruct.glowstone.flavor: Brightest day, blackest night, no cave will escape my light!
material.tconstruct.glowstone.ammo: Causes the target to glow for 10 seconds per level. If it hits a block, places a permanent light source at the cost of the projectile.
material.tconstruct.ancient_hide.flavor: Leather tanned by the oldest of stone
material.tconstruct.ancient_hide.encyclo: Increases drop chances from blocks, stacking with luck
material.tconstruct.ancient.flavor: They don't make them like they used to.
material.tconstruct.ancient.encyclopedia: Found on war picks, swashers, and battlesigns, plus from bartering. Each level grants +1 ability slot at the cost of -10% attack speed, -10% mining speed, and +10% gravity.
material.tconstruct.ancient.ranged: Available on melting pans, war picks, and from bartering. Each level grants +1 ability slot at the cost of -10% draw speed, and +10% gravity.
material.tconstruct.ancient.armor: Obtained on plate armor in bastions, battle signs, melting pans, and from bartering. Each level grants +1 ability slot at the cost of +10% gravity, and -10% movement speed or -10% attack speed on shields.
material.tconstruct.knightmetal.flavor: Metal of the traveling slime, also found from armored Twilight creatures.
material.tconstruct.knightmetal.encyclop: Grants +0.5 damage per level per piece of armor worn by the target
material.tconstruct.knightmetal.ranged: Grants +0.25 damage per level per piece of armor worn by the target (before velocity)
material.tconstruct.knightmetal.armor: Increases protection by 4% per level per item in the attacker's arms
material.tconstruct.knightly.flavor: Shard of the traveling slime, sharper when unrefined.
material.tconstruct.knightly.ammo: Grants +0.25 damage per level per piece of armor worn by the target (before velocity)
material.tconstruct.end_rod.ammo: Projectile ignores gravity for the first second of its life
material.tconstruct.enderslime_vine.ency: Teleports the holder to the location of mined blocks or swaps the holder with attacked monsters
material.tconstruct.enderslime_vine.rang: Teleports the holder to the location of arrows that land in blocks or swaps the holder with monsters hit by arrows
material.tconstruct.enderslime_vine.armo: Has a 25% chance per piece of randomly teleporting attackers away
material.tconstruct.enderslime.ammo: Causes the target to be teleported randomly up to 16 blocks, or up to 24 blocks at level 2.
material.tconstruct.osmium.flavor: Too dense to get most jokes
material.tconstruct.osmium.encyclopedia: Prevents 33% of damage at the cost of an extra 25% repair cost at first level
material.tconstruct.lead.flavor: Could try and make a sandwich out of this.
material.tconstruct.lead.encyclopedia: Grants +15% mining speed, +10% knockback resistance, -10% movement speed, and +5% gravity per level
material.tconstruct.lead.ranged: Grants +0.1 accuracy, +10% knockback resistance, -10% movement speed, and +5% gravity per level
material.tconstruct.lead.armor: Grants +15% knockback resistance, -10% movement speed, and +5% gravity per level
material.tconstruct.silver.flavor: You know, this tool isn't going to look so shiny in a few days.
material.tconstruct.silver.encyclopedia: Gives +2 damage against undead per level
material.tconstruct.silver.ranged: Gives +0.75 projectile power against undead per level
material.tconstruct.silver.armor: Reduces damage from undead by 5% per level
material.tconstruct.whitestone.flavor: Take your useless white metals or rocks and make a useful tool
material.tconstruct.whitestone.encyclope: Mining stone has a 20% per level of granting +3 stoneshield
material.tconstruct.aluminum.ranged: Grants +0.07 drawspeed and accuracy at the cost of 5% loss of protection
material.tconstruct.aluminum.armor: Grants +5% use item speed at the cost of 5% loss of protection
material.tconstruct.treated_wood.encyclo: Increases both durability and repair efficiency by 15%
material.tconstruct.ironwood.encyclopedi: When losing 1 durability, tool loses 1 extra durability (bypassing modifiers) to share durability with a random tool in the hotbar or offhand. Target gains 1 barkskin plus 1 per level.
material.tconstruct.ironwood.armor: When losing 1 durability, tool loses 1 extra durability (bypassing modifiers) to share durability with a random equipped armor. Target gains 1 barkskin plus 1 per level.
material.tconstruct.steel.encyclopedia: Grants +10% durability and +5% melee damage per level
material.tconstruct.steel.ranged: Grants +10% durability and +0.25 projectile power per level
material.tconstruct.steel.armor: Grants +10% durability and +1 toughness per level
material.tconstruct.magnetite.ammo: Attracts mobs within a radius of 3 blocks per level towards the place the projectile hits
material.tconstruct.bronze.flavor: Not to be confused with amethyst bronze.
material.tconstruct.bronze.encyclopedia: Grants +6 mining speed per level at full durability, 0 boost below 50% durability
material.tconstruct.bronze.ranged: Grants +0.08 velocity per level at full durability, 0 boost below 50% durability
material.tconstruct.bronze.armor: Boosts toughness by 2 per level when at full durability, but boost drops to 0 below 50% durability
material.tconstruct.constantan.flavor: Constantantantantantantan... Sorry it's fun to add more "tans."
material.tconstruct.constantan.encyclope: Grants +7.5 mining speed in extreme cold and twice reinforced in extreme heat
material.tconstruct.constantan.ranged: Grants +0.15 velocity in extreme cold and twice reinforced in extreme heat
material.tconstruct.constantan.armor: Grants 5% protection in extreme cold and twice reinforced in extreme heat
material.tconstruct.invar.encyclopedia: Grants +15% damage, -10% movement speed, and +5% gravity per level
material.tconstruct.invar.ranged: Grants +0.75 power, -10% movement speed, and +5% gravity per level
material.tconstruct.invar.armor: Grants 5% protection, -10% movement speed, and +5% gravity per level
material.tconstruct.pewter.encyclopedia: Grants +0.25 damage per level per health lost below 11
material.tconstruct.pewter.ranged: Grants +0.1 power per level per health lost below 11
material.tconstruct.pewter.armor: Grants 1% protection per level per health lost below 11
material.tconstruct.electrum.encyclopedi: Deals +2 damage per level against targets in water, or +1 damage per level against targets in rain
material.tconstruct.electrum.ranged: Grants +1 power per level against targets in water, or +0.5 power per level against targets in rain
material.tconstruct.electrum.armor: Has a 20% chance per level to apply 2 to 5 damage to attackers in water, or a 10% chance per level for attackers in rain
material.tconstruct.necronium.flavor: This much decay probably only leaves it with a quarter life
material.tconstruct.necronium.encycloped: Causes at least 5 seconds of wither, to your target and at a 25% chance to you
material.tconstruct.necronium.armor: Has a 50% chance when hit (or 100% chance if blocking) to wither the attacker for at least 5 seconds, plus a 10% chance to wither you
material.tconstruct.plated_slimewood.fla: All the shininess of brass with the squish of slime
material.tconstruct.plated_slimewood.enc: Grants +100% to all methods of restoring overslime
material.tconstruct.steeleaf.ammo: Increases loot drops of targets killed with the projectile. Stacks with luck and looting from bows.
material.tconstruct.steeleaf.encyclopedi: Grants +50% XP per level from blocks and monsters
material.tconstruct.steeleaf.ranged: Grants +50% XP per level from monsters killed by arrows
material.tconstruct.steeleaf.armor: Grants +25% XP per level from blocks and monsters
material.tconstruct.fiery.flavor: The hottest new metal, forged to perfection.
material.tconstruct.fiery.encyclopedia: Tool automatically smelts all drops. Higher levels have a 20% chance of an extra smelted drops per level
material.tconstruct.fiery.ranged: Arrows automatically smelts all drops. Higher levels have a 20% chance of an extra smelted drops per level
material.tconstruct.fiery.armor: Increases protection by 5% per level against on fire attackers
modifier.tconstruct.empty.description: Fallback for when a modifier is missing
modifier.tconstruct.shiny.description: Tool glows with an enchanted glint
modifier.tconstruct.farsighted.descripti: Decreases the field of vision while equipped
modifier.tconstruct.nearsighted.descript: Increases the field of vision while equipped
modifier.tconstruct.offhanded.flavor: Don't think about it too hard
modifier.tconstruct.offhanded.descriptio: Disables the tools interaction abilities when the offhand is filled. Second level disables interaction abilities entirely.
modifier.tconstruct.blunted.description: Prevents the tool from performing melee attacks on hitting a mob, making it easier to use interaction abilities.
modifier.tconstruct.barebow.description: Bow will not use arrows from the inventory, though will still use arrows from quiver or crystalshot.
modifier.tconstruct.reinforced.descripti: Tool is less likely to take damage
modifier.tconstruct.overforced.descripti: Tool is reinforced using slime, allowing more capacity for overslime
modifier.tconstruct.emerald.flavor: Villagers will want to be you!
modifier.tconstruct.emerald.description: Increases durability depending on base durability! Boosts effectiveness of conditional damage and mining speed
modifier.tconstruct.worldbound.descripti: A crude version of netherite, granting immunity to external damage like fire, but no additional strength
modifier.tconstruct.soulbound.descriptio: Tool remains in inventory on death!
modifier.tconstruct.netherite.descriptio: Harness the power of ancient metal, making the tool stronger and immune to external damage such as fire
modifier.tconstruct.overslime.descriptio: Tool consumes overslime instead of durability, until it runs out! Not friendly towards tools lacking slime
modifier.tconstruct.experienced.descript: Gain bonus XP from killing mobs and mining blocks
modifier.tconstruct.haste.description: Magic red dust makes tool mine faster!
modifier.tconstruct.blasting.description: Your tool breaks blocks weak to explosions, such as ores, faster!
modifier.tconstruct.hydraulic.descriptio: Tool mines faster underwater or in the rain!
modifier.tconstruct.lightspeed.descripti: Tool mines well lit blocks faster! Boots move faster in the light!
modifier.tconstruct.knockback.descriptio: Hitting things in melee makes them go flying further!
modifier.tconstruct.padded.description: Reduces the knockback of the tool, to stop your enemies from escaping
modifier.tconstruct.severing.flavor: Not just the heads, but the feet, and the feathers!
modifier.tconstruct.severing.description: Potentially blasts heads or other parts of targets of melee right off!
modifier.tconstruct.fiery.flavor: Infused with the fires of hell!
modifier.tconstruct.fiery.description: Ignites targets of melee attacks, fired arrows, and counterattacks
modifier.tconstruct.necrotic.description: Critical hits on enemies drains their life to heal you
modifier.tconstruct.piercing.description: Tool deals bonus damage which attacks through armor!
modifier.tconstruct.pierce.description: Attacks cancels out some of the target's armor!
modifier.tconstruct.smite.description: Undead fear the might of the melon!
modifier.tconstruct.bane_of_sssss.flavor: That'sss a nice ssspider you have there!
modifier.tconstruct.bane_of_sssss.descri: Tool does bonus damage against spiders, creepers and other creepey crawly hissing things!
modifier.tconstruct.antiaquatic.descript: Tool does bonus damage to sea creatures!
modifier.tconstruct.killager.description: Increases damage against villagers, illagers, and other longnosed creatures!
modifier.tconstruct.cooling.description: Tool does bonus damage to fire based creatures!
modifier.tconstruct.sweeping_edge.descri: Targets of sweep attack take a larger percentage of this tool's damage
modifier.tconstruct.sharpness.descriptio: Tool is so much sharper, dealing more damage!
modifier.tconstruct.swiftstrike.descript: Magic purple gems make the weapon lighter and easier to swing!
modifier.tconstruct.power.flavor: The power within becomes the power without
modifier.tconstruct.power.description: Boosts damage of arrows and other launched projectiles
modifier.tconstruct.keen.description: Boosts damage when the projectile hits the target
modifier.tconstruct.weak.description: Reduces damage when the projectile hits the target
modifier.tconstruct.quick_charge.flavor: For when you are tired of all the extra fees
modifier.tconstruct.drawback.description: Causes the arrow to apply knockback in the opposite direction, pulling in the target
modifier.tconstruct.impaling.flavor: Just keeps on going and going and going
modifier.tconstruct.impaling.description: Arrows keep moving after hitting a target, potentially hitting more targets
modifier.tconstruct.spike.description: Arrows keeps moving after hitting a target, while thrown ammo disable shields
modifier.tconstruct.trueshot.flavor: This bow will always aim true
modifier.tconstruct.trueshot.description: Increases the accuracy of the weapon
modifier.tconstruct.blindshot.flavor: Gonna put some dirt in your eye
modifier.tconstruct.blindshot.descriptio: Decreases the accuracy of the weapon
modifier.tconstruct.erratic.description: Decreases the accuracy of the arrow
modifier.tconstruct.freezing.description: Causes melee attacks, fired arrows, and counterattacks to freeze the target
modifier.tconstruct.bulk_quiver.descript: Allows the bow to pull arrows from its own inventory when you run out of arrows, access by sneaking and attacking
modifier.tconstruct.trick_quiver.descrip: Gives the bow three toggleable arrow slots. Select the slot by attacking, or access them by sneaking and attacking
modifier.tconstruct.crystalshot.descript: In place of arrows, fires shards of crystal grown from the bow itself. Growing crystals consumes extra durability
modifier.tconstruct.multishot.descriptio: Allows shooting multiple arrows at once
modifier.tconstruct.sinistral.flavor: It sounds evil, but I assure you its a perfectly natural condition
modifier.tconstruct.sinistral.descriptio: When in main hand, crossbow fires when attacking instead of interacting and will not load while sneaking.

tool_stat.tconstruct.attack_speed.descri:
Base value for melee attack speed calculations.
Roughly is number of full strength attacks per second.
tool_stat.tconstruct.durability.descript:
The base-value for durability calculations.
Usually an integral part to the overall durability of a tool.
tool_stat.tconstruct.use_item_speed.desc: Movement speed multiplier when using an item, such as a bow or a shield.
stat.tconstruct.head: Head

How fast a tool with a tool head of this material can mine blocks.
May be influenced by other toolparts.
tool_stat.tconstruct.harvest_tier.descri: What range of blocks a tool with a tool head of this material can mine.
tool_stat.tconstruct.attack_damage.descr:
Base value for melee attack damage calculations.
The end result depends on the tool itself and the other components used.

gui.tconstruct.crafting_station.uncrafta: This item is not currently craftable by the player
gui.tconstruct.part_builder.info:
Here you can craft tool parts to fulfill your tinkering fantasies.

To craft a part simply put a blank pattern into the left slot and select the part you want. The remaining slot holds the material you want to craft your part out of.
Material cannot be shaped in the part builder. Other methods such as casting are required.
gui.tconstruct.tinker_station.repair_lim: Allows creating all basic tools and applying most modifiers. Select a layout from the buttons on the left to get started.
gui.tconstruct.tinker_station.repair.des: Create both small and broad tools and modify existing tools to fulfil your dreams! Select a layout from the buttons on the left to get started.
gui.tconstruct.tinker_station.info: The main way to repair or change your tools. Place a tool and a material on the left to get started.
